metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26963 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Repeated calls to the history and location interfaces could have been used to hang the browser. This was addressed by introducing rate-limiting to these API calls. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-26963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
